Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram

Class InheritanceManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.ClassDiagramRelationsManager
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.InheritanceManager
public class InheritanceManager extends ClassDiagramRelationsManager

Inheritance Manager

The InheritanceManager is responsible for creating and rendering inheritance relationships between classes in a UML class diagram. This class handles the creation of inheritance lines and dynamically updating these elements when classes are moved.

It inherits from ClassDiagramRelationsManager and implements the abstract method createRelationship(javafx.scene.layout.VBox, javafx.scene.layout.VBox, javafx.scene.layout.Pane, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String), which is used to create a composition relationship between two classes.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-04

  • Constructor Details

    • InheritanceManager

      public InheritanceManager(ClassDiagramManager manager)
      Constructs an InheritanceManager instance.

      This constructor initializes the manager with the specified ClassDiagramManager and enables the inheritance mode by default.

      Parameters:
      manager - The ClassDiagramManager instance managing the overall diagram.

  • Method Details

    • createRelationship

      public void createRelationship(javafx.scene.layout.VBox start, javafx.scene.layout.VBox end, javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane, String inheritanceName, String startMultiplicity, String endMultiplicity)
      Creates an inheritance relationship between two UML elements.

      This method calculates the closest boundary points of the two given VBox elements representing the classes and creates an inheritance line between them. The line is added to the drawingPane.

      Specified by:
      createRelationship in class ClassDiagramRelationsManager
      Parameters:
      start - The starting UML element (child).
      end - The ending UML element (parent).
      drawingPane - The pane where the relationship is drawn.
      inheritanceName - The name of the inheritance relationship (optional).
      startMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the start end (optional, typically not used in inheritance).
      endMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the end (optional, typically not used in inheritance).

    • createRelationshipFromModel

      public void createRelationshipFromModel(UMLRelationship umlRelationship, javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane)
      Creates an inheritance relationship from a UMLRelationship model object during deserialization.

      This method recreates an inheritance relationship using data from a UMLRelationship object and adds the elements (line and triangle) to the specified drawingPane.

      Parameters:
      umlRelationship - The UMLRelationship data.
      drawingPane - The pane where the relationship is drawn.

    • getLastRelationshipBox

      public UMLRelationshipBox getLastRelationshipBox()
      Gets the last created UMLRelationshipBox.
      Returns:
      The last UMLRelationshipBox.
